metadata.dc:author: Carballo, Monserrat
Feijoo, M
Llinas, Montserrat
metadata.dc:description: The study group consisted of 121 patients, 37 or 30.5% women and 84 or 69.4% men, checked into the Internal Medicine and Infectious Diseases Hospitalization Unit who bore a total of 215 peripheral venous catheters. The authors of this study detected a high level occurrence of phlebitis in patients using peripheral venous catheters, with a low average duration time, during the period in which the authors carried out their study.
metadata.dc:title: Flebitis en catéteres periféricos (y II). Un estudio.
[Phlebitis in peripheral catheters (II). A study].
